name: datura
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
any of several plants or bushes often grown in gardens, with large flowers that have a wide round opening at the top, sloping sides, and a narrow base, and leaves and seeds containing a substance used as a psychoactive drug (= one that affects your mind) or poison: Prune daturas if they have become misshapen or too big. Datura leaves are roughly textured with sharply pointed lobes and the stems are a purplish colour.
More examplesFewer examplesDaturas seem to have done well in pots outside this summer.The datura and rhododendron were in full bloom in the garden.Because datura is a legal plant, its cultivation or use as a drug cannot be policed.
